articles.title: Atmospheric aerosol concentrations are decreasing, but ground measurements and climate models still differ - Science Daily
articles.description: An international study shows that the number of atmospheric aerosol particles measured at observation sites across Europe has, on average, declined since the beginning of the 2000s. The declining trend was also observed by the climate models studied, but on a…

articles.title: Mars Express looks at mysterious Martian moon after software update - The Indian Express
articles.description: The European Space Agency's Mars Express was launched more than 19 years ago. The MARSIS instrument aboard the spacecraft was designed to study Mars but a recent software update meant that it was able to take observations of Phobos, the larger of Mars's two m…
articles.content: After nearly twenty years of operation, the European Space Agencys (ESA) Mars Express spacecraft has received a software update that allows it to look at the mysterious Martian moon Phobos at much gr… [+3454 chars]

articles.author: Lisa Steyn
articles.title: As a diesel crisis spreads in the West, could SA be next? | Fin24 - News24
articles.description: Diesel troubles have hit the US, with dears building in Europe, but South Africa is not as concerned about supply as it is about prices.
articles.content: As a diesel supply crisis hits the US and builds in Europe, fuel prices in South Africa will reach a record high this week, stoking inflationary pressures already weighing on critical industries and … [+460 chars]
